heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 03 October 2025 and it lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: Weather's been pretty steady overall — nothing much to report.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 144.4m higher than yesterday, 161.4m higher than the past week, 54.4m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 809m minimum and 2820m maximum, with an average of 1627.6m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1466.2m and 1682.1m.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, air moisture should feel ok and calm and still conditions are expected. Possible light showers, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and a mix of sun and clouds. Little change in the weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (87%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
